topics.body:
"@uc9":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/543195386368726d1f8a0000#post_543195386368726d1f8a0000
I'm hetero and was raised Christian. But I don't feel my beliefs are threatened by this "gay marriage" thing.
But then again, some may believe that the real danger in this becoming _too mainstream_, is that those who are genuinely heteros may have a tougher time finding a partner. Imagine what it will be like if someone had to look for a partner, but find out that everyone decent is gay or lesbian. Just saying.
topics.author: 4fde5cee945b700a970060fc

topics.body:
"@SeraphimDawn":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/543196806368721efc200100#post_543196806368721efc200100
I'm going to reference Kinsey here, but even in a most extreme case scenario of what you're talking about we're still only looking at most 1/10 people being bi and 1/40 people being gay.

Basically what I'm talking about is that the person who was the first to ever study human sexuality found that about one out of ten people had bisexual tendencies and about one out of forty were completely homosexual.  The reason when you get down to it that glbt seem uncommon is because of bisexual erasure meant to skew results in favor of making us seem uncommon.  Hell for the longest time bisexuality wasn't recognized as existing at all and it was viewed as you either "had" to be straight or gay and no in-between.  Even in a most extreme scenario we're only talking about 1/10 people being bi and 1/40 being gay.

I know it's not exactly credible, but that's my feelings on it cause just now mainstream culture is starting to realize bisexuals exist.
topics.author: 38b55cdf63616403d7560600

topics.body:
"@mariomarc":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/543199d36368724e10a70000#post_543199d36368724e10a70000
That's fairly true actually; bisexuality and in fact sexuality isn't a binary, rather it's a gradient.  Like just cause I prefer women over guys doesn't make me not bisexual.

It's kind of funny whenever I have this conversation with people.
Other people, "but you can't be bisexual; bisexual means you like both sexes equally"
"Do you want me to show you a phone picture of me giving a guy a blowjob?"
"Eww no!"
